solution_line_template: Taking the boxes of pans out of the total attic boxes shows that {total_attic_boxes} boxes - {boxes_of_pans} boxes of pans = {boxes_decorations_or_teacups} boxes are either decorations or teacups.

Since half of these boxes are decorations, the other half must be made up of {boxes_decorations_or_teacups} boxes / {half_divisor} = <<{boxes_decorations_or_teacups}/{half_divisor}={boxes_of_teacups}>>{boxes_of_teacups} boxes of teacups.
Each box of cups initially has {rows_per_box} rows x {cups_per_row} cups = <<{rows_per_box}*{cups_per_row}={initial_cups_per_box}>>{initial_cups_per_box} teacups inside.

Samuel breaks cups each time he picks up a box, which means each box now contains {initial_cups_per_box} - {broken_cups_per_box} = <<{initial_cups_per_box}-{broken_cups_per_box}={remaining_cups_per_box}>>{remaining_cups_per_box} teacups.
Therefore, there are {boxes_of_teacups} boxes * {remaining_cups_per_box} teacups = <<{boxes_of_teacups}*{remaining_cups_per_box}={total_teacups_left}>>{total_teacups_left} teacups left.
